name: analytic

analytic adjective
(DETAILED)

mainly US examining or liking to examine things in detail, in order to discover more about them: New analytic techniques in biology are allowing scientists to study the cell in more detail. The analytic methods we developed for this project will be useful for our future work. Synonym
analytical
More examplesFewer examplesThe university is known for its analytic approach to the subject.She was regarded as a highly analytic expert in the field of marketing.The approach the team took was analytic, but other approaches are possible.

analytic adjective
(LOGIC)
formal relating to or using logic (= a formal scientific method of examining or thinking about ideas): This book is one of the masterpieces of analytic philosophy.
formal (of a statement) true only because of the meanings of the words, without referring to facts or experience: Analytic truth is only regarded as true because it is independent of experience. All of their claims rely on empirical data and so are not purely analytic.
More examplesFewer examplesThis statement is analytic, because it is not judged by reference to facts in the real world.These arguments rely on a distinction between analytic and synthetic statements.
